network

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • network.Server

  • public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles server. each time clients are connected to server, all their information is updated and checked via server. server checks all the info with a file that stores players information.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Server()
      constructor to create all needed fields.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void changeUserFiles(java.lang.String oldUsername, java.lang.String newUsername)
      This method changes all user files if the username is changed
      void changeUserInFile(java.lang.String oldUser, java.lang.String newUSer, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> newInfo)
      this method changes the file if username has been changed.
      java.io.File createAFile()
      This method creates a file which stores all information The file is created only once.
      boolean isChangeAvailable(java.lang.String oldUsername, java.lang.String newUsername)
      This method checks if changing username is available.
      boolean isLoginAvailable(java.lang.String username)
      This method checks if login is available
      boolean isSignUpAvailable(java.lang.String username)
      This method checks if sign up is available
      void restoreUserInfo()
      method to restore all file lines into user info hashmap in the beginning each time the server is called, all the information will be restored from file to hashmaps.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> returnAllInfo()
      This method reads all info from file and stores them in an array list of strings.
      void waitForClient()
      This method creates a connection socket and waits for clients

      This method gets the strings and writes them to hashmap and files

    • Method Detail

      • restoreUserInfo

        public void restoreUserInfo()
        method to restore all file lines into user info hashmap in the beginning each time the server is called, all the information will be restored from file to hashmaps.

      • writeToFile

        public void writeToFile(java.lang.String username,
                        java.lang.String mode,
                        java.lang.String type,
                        java.lang.Integer wins,
                        java.lang.Integer looses,
                        java.lang.Integer score)
        This method gets the strings and writes them to hashmap and files
        Parameters:
        username - player username
        mode - game mode
        type - game type
        wins - number of wins
        looses - number of loses
        score - score

      • waitForClient

        public void waitForClient()
        This method creates a connection socket and waits for clients

      • isChangeAvailable

        public boolean isChangeAvailable(java.lang.String oldUsername,
                                 java.lang.String newUsername)
        This method checks if changing username is available. usernames in file are checked.
        Parameters:
        oldUsername - the username that player already has
        newUsername - new username
        Returns:
        false if the username is already taken, true if change is possibel

      • changeUserFiles

        public void changeUserFiles(java.lang.String oldUsername,
                            java.lang.String newUsername)
        This method changes all user files if the username is changed
        Parameters:
        oldUsername - old username
        newUsername - new username

      • isLoginAvailable

        public boolean isLoginAvailable(java.lang.String username)
        This method checks if login is available
        Parameters:
        username - player username
        Returns:
        true if possible, false otherwise

      • isSignUpAvailable

        public boolean isSignUpAvailable(java.lang.String username)
        This method checks if sign up is available
        Parameters:
        username - player username
        Returns:
        true if available, false otherwise

      • changeUserInFile

        public void changeUserInFile(java.lang.String oldUser,
                             java.lang.String newUSer,
                             java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> newInfo)
        this method changes the file if username has been changed.
        Parameters:
        oldUser - old username that needs to be changed
        newUSer - new username
        newInfo - info that needs to be overwritten

      • createAFile

        public java.io.File createAFile()
                         throws java.io.IOException
        This method creates a file which stores all information The file is created only once. Each line in this file has this format: username,mode,type,wins,loses,score
        Returns:
        the created file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - possible exception

      • returnAllInfo

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> returnAllInfo()
        This method reads all info from file and stores them in an array list of strings.
        Returns:
        array list of strings containing file info.
